channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Coronavirus: NI asks for more assistance from military medics
item.description: The MoD is considering a request to send up to 100 armed services medics to Northern Ireland.

item.title: NI100: DUP asks Irish president to rethink centenary invite
item.description: The service is part of a programme of events to mark the centenary of the partition of Ireland.

item.title: Holyland: 12 arrests after crowds gather in Holyland
item.description: Groups of young people continue to gather on Belfast streets ahead of the new university term.

item.title: Belfast African community celebrates city's Zimbabwe-born lord mayor
item.description: NI's African community holds an event to celebrate Belfast's Zimbabwe-born lord mayor.

item.title: North coast of NI property boom 'pushes locals away'
item.description: House prices in the Causeway Coast and Glens area rose by 17% in the last year, according to Nisra.

item.title: Conor Burns appointed minister of state at Northern Ireland Office
item.description: The Conservative MP returns to his native Belfast to work with Secretary of State Brandon Lewis.

item.title: Covid-19: NI records five Covid-linked deaths, 1,071 cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to coronavirus in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,483.

item.title: Queen's University students within 40 miles 'unlikely' to get room
item.description: Those living within that radius are told to make "alternative travel and accommodation arrangements".

item.title: Eric Eoin Marques: Irish man jailed in US for child abuse images
item.description: The FBI called Irish man Eric Eoin Marques the world's largest facilitator of online child sex abuse.

item.title: Donegal: Church leaders call for redress for mica families
item.description: Thousands of homes in the Republic of Ireland are crumbling because of bricks made of mica and pyrite.

item.title: Stephen Clements added to IMRO Radio Awards Hall of Fame
item.description: The former BBC Radio Ulster presenter is among "amazing broadcasters" recognised by IMRO.

item.title: Sir Elton delays Belfast gig after 'awkward fall'
item.description: The rock star says it "breaks my heart" to postpone, but he is still recovering from a hip injury.

item.title: Covid-19: Mother and daughter die days apart in hospital
item.description: Sammie-Jo Forde, 32. was treated two hospital beds away from her mother after both contracted the virus.

item.title: Covid-19: Close-contact pupils 'should not be sent home from school'
item.description: Officials say schools should not identify close contacts unless asked by the Public Health Agency.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccines for over-12s and boosters for over 50s
item.description: Northern Ireland's 12 to 15-year-olds will be offered one jab, while all over-50s and healthcare staff can get a third.

item.title: Covid-19: More than 10% of pupils not in school last week
item.description: Figures suggest about 10,000 pupils were at home due to self-isolation or social distancing.

item.title: Northern Ireland nurses 'showing signs of inability to keep going'
item.description: The Royal College of Nursing calls for urgent action with hospitals under pressure.

item.title: What are Northern Ireland's Covid-19 rules now?
item.description: How do restrictions here compare to other parts of the UK and the Republic of Ireland?

item.title: Can NI women upset the odds once more?
item.description: Ahead of the start of qualification for the 2023 World Cup, can Northern Ireland pull off another major upset and reach the finals?

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: How seeking help allowed Tyrone's Meyler to blossom
item.description: Conor Meyler says seeking help after going through "a very low point" caused by an overly-intense mindset sparked a turning point in his career

item.title: Miss Ireland 2021: First black winner 'proud' of crown
item.description: Pamela Uba moved to the country as a seven-year-old - now she's making history after taking the title.

item.title: Q&A: The Simon Coveney appointment row
item.description: Ireland's foreign affairs minister won a confidence motion over the appointment of a UN special envoy.

item.title: Queen's University students within 40 miles 'unlikely' to get room
item.description: Queen's University Belfast has said it is "unlikely" to offer a room to any student living less than 40 miles from the university.

item.title: NI100: 'May be politics' in Higgins not attending service, says DUP
item.description: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson says politics may be involved in Irish President Michael D Higgins' decision to decline an invite to a church service to mark Northern Ireland's centenary.

item.title: Colum Eastwood defends President Higgins over NI centenary event
item.description: SDLP leader Colum Eastwood says people should take it at face value when President Michael D Higgins says he cannot attend a NI centenary church service.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Concerts won't happen if distancing isn't removed'
item.description: Concert promoters say restrictions at indoor gigs mean big acts are pulling out of Northern Ireland.

item.title: Londonderry: Taxi driver firms 'struggling to meet demand'
item.description: Eamonn O'Donnell from North West Taxi Proprietors says it is difficult to provide a proper service.

item.title: Lyra McKee: Four men arrested in connection with journalist's death
item.description: The men, aged 19, 20, 21 and 33, were all detained on Wednesday under the Terrorism Act.

item.title: Londonderry: Man dies in Clooney Terrace house fire
item.description: Police are conducting enquiries but say at this stage the death is not being treated as suspicious.

item.title: All-Ireland final: Tyrone players given heroes' welcome
item.description: Thousands of fans cheer on the All-Ireland champions at their home ground of Healy Park in Omagh.

item.title: Simon Coveney: Irish foreign minister wins confidence vote
item.description: Ireland's foreign minister was under pressure over the appointment of a UN special envoy.

item.title: TikTok faces privacy investigations by EU watchdog
item.description: The Irish regulator says it is looking at how TikTok handles children's data - and where it goes.

item.title: Kerry Babies: Remains exhumed in 1984 baby death investigation
item.description: A baby boy at the centre of an infamous Irish scandal has never been identified.

item.title: Nancy Stewart: One of Ireland's oldest women dies aged 107
item.description: Nancy Stewart from Clonard in County Meath died on Friday morning at her family home.

item.title: Donegal mica: Crumbling house homeowners protest
item.description: Protesters want the Irish government to revamp a support scheme which they say is not fit for purpose.
